snippet: The Huntington Free Library and Reading Room in the Bronx, which lost some of its importance after giving up its American Indian collection, is trying on the role of a community library.
abstract: Huntington Free Library and Reading Room in the Bronx, which gave up its American Indian collection in 2004, is working to become a community library; instead of catering to scholars studying American Indians, it now hosts monthly meetings about Bronx history and activities for local children; its struggle to stay relevant illustrates the challenges facing New York's trove of historic homes and libraries at a time of shrinking endowments and shifting public interest.
lead_paragraph: The Huntington Free Library and Reading Room in the Bronx, which lost some of its importance after giving up its American Indian collection, is trying on the role of a community library.

headline.seo: Huntington Library in Bronx Struggles for Relevance
headline.main: Private Library Labors to Be Relevant Again
headline.print_headline: Private Library Labors To Be Relevant Again
